00084 int main(int argc, char **argv)
00085 {
00086   int run_no=0,run_no2=-1; // set default run numbers
00087   // set up the directory structure and file names to be read in
00088   char file_dir_in[100], file_dir_out[100], header[100];
00089  
00090   //getopt parsing
00091   int c;
00092   bool flag_type=false;
00093   bool flag_det=false;
00094   opterr = 0;
00095   while ((c = getopt (argc, argv, "R:H:I:Brdsxtp")) != -1)
00096    switch (c)
00097      {
00098      case 'R':
00099        flag_Run = true;
00100         sscanf(optarg,"%i",&run_no);
00101        break;
00102      case 'B':
00103        flag_Batch = true;
00104        break;
00105      case 'H':
00106        flag_Header = true;
00107         sscanf(optarg,"%s",&header[0]);
00108        break;
00109      case 'I':
00110        flag_Inpath = true;
00111         sscanf(optarg,"%s",&file_dir_in[0]);
00112        break;
00113      case 'r':
00114        flag_raw = true;
00115        flag_type=true;
00116        break;
00117      case 'd':
00118        flag_detail = true;
00119        flag_type=true;
00120        break;
00121      case 's':
00122        flag_ssd = true;
00123        flag_det=true;
00124        break;
00125      case 'x':
00126        flag_strip = true;
00127        flag_det=true;
00128        break;
00129      case 'p':
00130        flag_ppac = true;
00131        flag_det=true;
00132        break;
00133      case 't':
00134        flag_tpc = true;
00135        flag_det=true;
00136        break;
00137      case '?': 
00138        if (optopt == 'c')
00139          fprintf (stderr, "Option -%c requires an argument.\n", optopt);
00140        else if (isprint (optopt))
00141          fprintf (stderr, "Unknown option `-%c'.\n", optopt);
00142        else
00143          fprintf (stderr,
00144                   "Unknown option character `\\x%x'.\n",
00145                   optopt);
00146        Usage();
00147        return 1;
00148      default:
00149        Usage();
00150        return 1;
00151      }
00152    if (!flag_type || !flag_det){ // we need some kind of data to analyze!
00153      Usage();
00154      return 1;
00155    }
00156    if (flag_Batch && !flag_Run){ // we need a run number for batch mode
00157      Usage();
00158      return 1;
00159    }
00160   
00161   ifstream runheaders;
00162   //We get the run header from run.conf
00163   runheaders.open("run.conf");
00164   string runentry, str_comment = "#";
00165   int lines=0;
00166   while (!runheaders.eof()){
00167     getline(runheaders,runentry);
00168     if (runentry[0] != str_comment[0] && runentry.length()!=0){
00169       lines++;
00170       if (lines > 3) break; // these are run flags for crabat
00171       if (lines==1 && !flag_Inpath) sprintf(file_dir_in,"%s",runentry.c_str()); // ROOT Input Tree location
00172       if (lines==2) sprintf(file_dir_out,"%s",runentry.c_str()); // ROOT Output Tree location
00173       if (lines==3 && !flag_Header) sprintf(header,"%s",runentry.c_str()); // Run header
00174     }   
00175   }
00176   runheaders.close();
00177   // set up the directory structure for file output
00178   char cmd[200];
00179   sprintf(cmd,"ls %s/%s/ > /dev/null",file_dir_out,header);
00180   cout << ".root files in targeted output directory: " << endl;
00181   if (system(cmd)) { // runs the system command.  if ls is successful, exit status 0, but if it failed exit status 1
00182     cout << "Creating output directory based on output directory: " << file_dir_out << " and header: " << header << endl; 
00183     sprintf(cmd,"mkdir %s/%s",file_dir_out,header); // if ls failed we need to create the directory for output 
00184     if (system(cmd)){ cout << "ERROR: No write permission in local directory!" << endl; return 1;} // if mkdir is not successful, report the error and quit
00185   }
00186   sprintf(cmd,"ls %s/%s/*.root 2> /dev/null",file_dir_out,header);
00187   if(system(cmd)){} // if statement only exists to avoid warn_unused_result
00188   //user friendly run selection
00189   if (run_no==0) { // run_no is init to 0, unless run is called with a run number explicity (batch mode)
00190     cout << "Existing runs are: " << endl;
00191     sprintf(cmd,"ls %s/%s*.root",file_dir_in,header);
00192     if (system(cmd)) {fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: input directory '%s' does not exist!\n",file_dir_in); return(1);} // if we can't find the location to read from, exit with fail status
00193     
00194     cout << endl << "Select a run to be analyzed \n";
00195     cout << "(ie: 1 means "<< file_dir_in <<   "/" <<  header << "0001.root \n";
00196     cout << "1-10 means processing runs 1 through 10): ";
00197   
00198     char runnums[200];
00199     cin >> runnums;
00200     sscanf(runnums,"%d-%d",&run_no,&run_no2);
00201   }
00202   Int_t run_proc = 0;
00203   if (run_no2==-1) { // only processing one run
00204     run_no2=run_no;
00205     cerr << "Processing run " << run_no <<  " only" << endl;
00206     run_proc = run_no;
00207   }
00208   else{
00209     cerr << "Processing run " << run_no <<  " through run " << run_no2 << endl;
00210   }
00211   char file_run[150];
00212   //exclude some run numbers for particular cases
00213   if (strcmp("30s_production",header)==0) {
00214     if (run_no==1006 || run_no==1007 || run_no==1008 || run_no==1009 || run_no==1010 || run_no==1016){
00215       cout << "Run number " << run_no << " is junk for 30S Production Runs" << endl;
00216       return 0;
00217     }
00218     if (run_no==1024 || run_no==1027 ){
00219       cout << "Run number " << run_no << " is calibration for 30S Production Runs" << endl;
00220       return 0;
00221     }
00222   }
00223   
00224   // report what data will be analyzed
00225   cout << "raw data: " << flag_raw << endl << "detailed data: " << flag_detail << endl <<
00226   "ssd: " << flag_ssd << endl <<  "ssd_strip: " << flag_strip << endl << "ppac: " << flag_ppac << endl << "tpc: " << flag_tpc << endl;
00227   
00228   Int_t nfiles; // count the number of files loaded
00229   TChain *ch=new TChain("rawdata"); // create a TChain in the case there is more than one root file to process
00230   
00231   for (int rn=run_no;rn<=run_no2;rn++) {
00232     //make the right file name out of the run
00233     
00234     //get a cout on the rn with the printf %4.4d
00235     sprintf(file_run,"%s/%s%4.4d.root",file_dir_in,header,rn);
00236     //do the analysis part
00237     cout << "loading file:" << file_run << endl;
00238    
00239     //Checking if the file exists.
00240     ifstream ifile(file_run);
00241     if (!ifile.is_open()) {
00242        cerr << file_run << " could not be opened." << endl;
00243        return(1); // exit with fail status
00244     }
00245     ifile.close();
00246     
00247     nfiles=ch->Add(file_run);
00248   } // end for: run_no
00249   
00250   // Initalize the histograms
00251   HistInit();
00252   // ANALYZE THE DATA!
00253   Analyzer t(ch); t.Loop(run_proc,flag_raw,flag_detail,flag_ssd,flag_strip,flag_ppac,flag_tpc);
00254   //t.Show(0);
00255   
00256   // set up the histogram output file
00257   char spectra_name[150];
00258   if (run_no==run_no2) {sprintf(spectra_name,"%s/%s/%s-%d.root",file_dir_out,header,header,run_no);}
00259   else {sprintf(spectra_name,"%s/%s/%s-%d_%d.root",file_dir_out,header,header,run_no,run_no2);}
00260   TFile *hist_file = new TFile(spectra_name,"RECREATE");
00261   
00262   HistWrite(); // Write the histograms
00263   hist_file->Write(); // write histograms to file
00264   hist_file->Close(); // close histogram file
00265 
00266   delete hist_file; // delete memory used for histogram file
00267 
00268   new TFile(spectra_name); // open the root file we made because I'm too lazy to find it myself 
00269   
00270   // Create interactive interface
00271   if (!flag_Batch) { //interactive mode is on
00272     TRint *theApp = new TRint("ROOT example", &argc, argv, NULL, 0);
00273     // Call an object browser
00274     new TBrowser();
00275     // Run interactive interface
00276     theApp->Run();
00277   }
00278   
00279   // clean up memory allocation
00280   delete ch; // delete the chain
00281   HistClean(); // clean the memory allocated for historgrams (defined in run.h)
00282   
00283   return(0);    // exit with success status
00284 }
